According to the ''[[Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders]], '''''necrophilia''', also called '''thanatophilia ''' and '''necrolagnia''', is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a [[human sexuality|sexual]] attraction to [[corpse]]s. The word derives from Ancient Greek: ''Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ '' (''nekros''; "corpse," or "dead") and ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î± (''philia''; "love").
â
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.{{fact}}
+
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic love| romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.{{fact}}
==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
